meanings.definition: A transparent, colorless, gelatinous substance found in the vitreous humor of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The hyaloids in the eye help maintain its shape and structure.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study hyaloids to understand eye health better.
meanings.sent3: The hyaloids in the eye are like invisible jellyfish swimming around.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like hyaloids in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The hyaloids glistened like dewdrops in the morning light.

meanings.definition: A type of connective tissue that is clear and gelatinous in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The hyaloids provide support and flexibility to tissues.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are exploring the properties of hyaloids in the body.
meanings.sent3: The hyaloids in the body feel like slippery noodles when touched.
meanings.sent4: His words were as clear and smooth as hyaloids.
meanings.sent5: The hyaloids in the body are like invisible threads holding everything together.
